revised_title: Molecular Orbital Perturbation Theory: Applications in Conjugated Molecules
tldr: The authors develop a perturbation method based on molecular orbital functions for the ground and excited states of conjugated molecules. They use this method to study the changes in energy and charge distribution when a perturbation is applied to the core potential. The results can be used to investigate factors influencing the physical and chemical properties of complex molecules, particularly in aromatic compounds.
